Column Comment.0: CATALOGUE ADDITIVE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the list of kinds ofadditives.
Column Comment.1: SPECIFICATION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a specification for an additive.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: CATALOGUE ADDITIVE IDENTIFIER COMPONENT: Unique identifier for the list ofkinds of additives. In this case, the additive that is a component of a new additive.
Column Comment.4: ADDITIVE SPECIFICATION TYPE: A list of the kinds of specifications that may bedefined for an additive, such as the volume added, weight added, mixing method,preparation method etc. For each ADDITIVE COMPONENT ID, more than onespecificataion could be defined.
Column Comment.5: VALUES: Use the values columns to capture numeric values such as weights,percentages, durations and so on. The size and scale for each value type may vary;this is defined in the PPDM PROPERTY SET for the governing reference values.
Column Comment.6: UNITS OF MEASURE and ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.7: UNITS OF MEASURE and ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.8: COST: A value associated with the cost of a specirfication, such as annual operatingcost.
Column Comment.9: CURRENCY CONVERSION: A number which, when multipled by the stored value,will re-create the original value in the original currency used.
Column Comment.10: CURRENCY ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure in which thecurrency was originally received.
Column Comment.11: UNITS OF MEASURE and ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.12: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.13: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.14: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.15: VALUES: Use the values columns to capture numeric values such as weights,percentages, durations and so on. The size and scale for each value type may vary;this is defined in the PPDM PROPERTY SET for the governing reference values.
Column Comment.16: UNITS OF MEASURE and ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.17: UNITS OF MEASURE and ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.18: VALUES: Use the values columns to capture numeric values such as weights,percentages, durations and so on. The size and scale for each value type may vary;this is defined in the PPDM PROPERTY SET for the governing reference values.
Column Comment.19: UNITS OF MEASURE and ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.20: UNITS OF MEASURE and ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.21: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.22: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.23: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.24: SPECIFICATION CODE: A code assigned to the value of this spec, such as a steelgrade. Used when values are assigned as text rather than as numbers.
Column Comment.25: SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION: A textual description of the specification property.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
